website_summaries.verdict: A starter chemistry kit that comes with real lab gear and a supply of 8 chemicals.
pros: Comes with beaker, test tube, Bunson burner, litmus paper, and other classic lab materials
Chemicals needed for the experiments come with the kit
cons: A few experiments require additional materials that may be challenging to locate

customer_reviews.title: Good set for young scientists.
customer_reviews.text: Nice set bought for a 10yo. We've gone through probably 10-15 experiments and its seems to be on par with basic chemistry that they touch on in school. Don't expect anything absolutely amazing but, it's better than the sets where you have to run around pinching household supplies.
customer_reviews.author: Rob D

customer_reviews.title: either way the experiments are fun. It has been her favorite Christmas gift
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this. She is almost 8. the experiments are all very quick so it never loses her excitement or attention. I wish the glass stirs were longer than the test tubes are deep. And I am yet to understand why they included 2 shorter glass stirs also. The instructions for the experiments can be a little vague (add a little of this chemical) makes it hard to know if it’s half a scoop or a granule.... either way the experiments are fun. It has been her favorite Christmas gift.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie/Kurt Stoddard

customer_reviews.title: Fun for a 10yr old, but very limited
customer_reviews.text: My 10yr old loves it, but the set is rather limited in what you can do. It's true that they took out all the "fun" stuff as being too dangerous vs old time sets. Nothing will explode, burn, or even get hot. You're down to pH experiments... cool but pretty tame. One of the test tubes broke... not close to real lab quality. She loves to use the beaker to make slime projects.
customer_reviews.author: On The Water

customer_reviews.title: Bad customer service
customer_reviews.text: Mine did not have instruction booklet. Left msg with number on box 3 times but no call back. Bad customer service. My kids and I are very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is so great! My 11 year old and year old had ...
customer_reviews.text: This is so great! My 11 year old and year old had so much fun with this. I loved watching the looks on their faces as they saw cooors change before their eyes. What a neat set. This is not a toy, but actual glass and chemicals. I can't wait to watch more! Get this for the science lover in your house or to inspire the hidden scientist!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Arrived without instruction manual
customer_reviews.text: arrived without an instruction manual. makes for not very much fun christmas morning.
customer_reviews.author: GiuliaTorreReads

customer_reviews.title: Appealing to 10 year old
customer_reviews.text: Purchased it for a 10 year old granddaughter who was excited to get it and was looking forward to using it.
customer_reviews.author: ecjan

customer_reviews.title: He loved it. It was a Christmas gift for my ...
customer_reviews.text: He loved it. It was a Christmas gift for my nephew who likes to "mix things."
customer_reviews.author: Satisfied Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a gift. I think there is just enough chemicals in it to make it interesting.
customer_reviews.author: Dianne Jones

customer_reviews.title: Stingy with the chemicals and more reaction info please
customer_reviews.text: The basics are here and it could be a good set. But: Don't be fooled by the size of the chemical bottles. There is very little in them The manual has very little by way of explaining the chemical processes I it would be great if the box could act as better storage as one needs to be able to put everything away. Not everyone has the luxury of a permanent lab station as recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Pablo

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Was pretty good except the copper wasn't foil like in the direction book and bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Giftable
customer_reviews.text: Ordered as a gift for a random name card on a christmas tree so hopefully they love it
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer westfall

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love it but my youngest? She made something and really liked it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great basic kit
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this kit for our 3rd and 6th graders. It’s a perfect basic introduction to chemistry.
customer_reviews.author: Selby

customer_reviews.title: Some of the experiments area a total joke. The ...
customer_reviews.text: Some of the experiments area a total joke. The heating burner does not help to heat experiments enough. Some of the chemical themselves are too less and not enough for all experiments.
customer_reviews.author: VC

customer_reviews.title: Yes!
customer_reviews.text: 37 year old dad ecstatic. Danger present as it says.... great starter kit with real deals.
customer_reviews.author: mcdona

customer_reviews.title: We use this in homeschooling and my son loves it ...
customer_reviews.text: We use this in homeschooling and my son loves it! We have done several experiments with success. It includes goggles though I wish it had included an apron.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Elenco Chemistry Lab - Revised
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a birthday present. My grandson, upon opening his gift found that no alcohol lamp was in the package. It clearly states that one should be there. Elenco made good on the alcohol lamp. I had a new one in about a week. Although, I feel that there could have been more chemicals in the kit
customer_reviews.author: D. W.

customer_reviews.title: Great set
customer_reviews.text: Kiddo thought is was great and it was not too expensive.
customer_reviews.author: firas issa

customer_reviews.title: I love the variety of chemicals included with the set
customer_reviews.text: Bought this set for my 11 year old daughter for Christmas. I love the variety of chemicals included with the set. I think she will love it!
customer_reviews.author: Jesse L. Foster

customer_reviews.title: Bought as a gift for one of my grandsons. ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift for one of my grandsons. This appears to be similar to the kits I had as a kid.
customer_reviews.author: ML

customer_reviews.title: Good but overpriced
customer_reviews.text: Good set to help build knowledge of chemistry. Appreciate the variety of experiments and supplies. Bought this for $16 yesterday and today it is $32. Not worth $32 dollars, though. Look up these experiments online and just buy the household items to complete the experiments. Overall good, but at a reasonable price, not double.
customer_reviews.author: Thankful Grateful Blessed

product_meta.title: Elenco Edu-Toys Chemistry Lab | Introduction to Chemistry Principles | Includes Everything You Need | Beakers, Test Tubes, Thermometer and More | Plus Safety Goggles
product_meta.description: 80 Chemistry Experiments and includes the following ●(8) Chemicals ●(8) Litmus Papers ●Test Tube Rack ●Test Tube Holder ●(2) Test Tubes with Stoppers ●(2) Stopper-Corks ●(2) Stopper-Corks with Holes ●(2) Glass Tubes ●Rubber Tube ●Spout Brush ●Funnel ●(6) Filter Papers ●Alcohol Lamp ●100mL Glass Beaker ●Measuring Spoon ●Scoop ●Dropper ●Stirring Rod ●Safety Goggles ●Instruction Manual.
feature_bullets: Everything you need for your first introduction to more serious Chemistry
Test tubes, Thermometers, Bunson burner, Corks, a Beaker, Chemicals and More
Safety first! Be sure to wear the included goggles
From Elenco the company that brought you the best selling line, Snap Circuits

Founded more than 40 years ago by 2 engineers, Elenco's goal is to provide children with great products that offer a hands-on experience and hours of creative playtime. With designs rooted in engineering, Elenco toys captivate and educate kids of all ages.
